bad-browser.message: Popcode doesn’t work with your version of {{name}}.
bad-browser.ie-message: Popcode doesn’t work with Internet Explorer or IE Edge. Please use another browser.
bad-browser.download: Click here to download a new version.

notifications.user-cancelled-auth: Looks like you didn’t finish linking GitHub to Popcode. Try again, and be sure to click the green “Authorize application” button.
notifications.auth-network-error: Looks like you’re having some internet trouble. Try signing in again.
notifications.auth-third-party-cookies-disabled: It looks like you have third-party cookies disabled. Please change your browser settings and try to log in again.
notifications.auth-error: Something went wrong trying to sign in. Please try again!
notifications.empty-gist: You need some code in your project to export a gist!
notifications.gist-export-error: Something went wrong trying to create that gist. Please try again.
notifications.gist-import-not-found: Looks like that gist doesn’t exist. Check the URL and try again.
notifications.gist-import-error: There was a problem importing that gist.
notifications.repo-export-error: Something went wrong trying to create that repo. Please try again.
notifications.snapshot-export-error: Something went wrong trying to create that snapshot. Please try again.
notifications.snapshot-import-error: Something went wrong trying to load that snapshot. Please try again.
notifications.snapshot-not-found: That snapshot doesn’t seem to exist. Check the link and try again.
notifications.classroom-export-complete: Your project is ready to share to Google Classroom
notifications.classroom-export-error: Something went wrong trying to share to Google Classroom. Please try again.
notifications.project-compilation-failed: Something went wrong trying to display a preview of your project. This is a bug in Popcode and we have been notified. Making another change to your code will likely fix this error.

confirmations.anonymous-gist-export: Are you sure you want to export this gist anonymously? If you sign in before exporting, the gist will be added to your GitHub account.

errors.undefined-description: Couldn't find a human description for
errors.notice: You have an error in your $t(languages.{{language}})!

banned-attributes.align: Don't use the `align` attribute. Instead, use the CSS `text-align` property
banned-attributes.background: Don't use the `background` attribute. Instead, use the CSS `background` property
banned-attributes.bgcolor: Don't use the `bgcolor` attribute. Instead, use the CSS `background-color` property
banned-attributes.frameborder: Don't use the `{{-attribute}}` attribute. Instead, use the CSS `border` property
banned-attributes.marginwidth: Don't use the `marginwidth` attribute. Instead, use the CSS `margin-left` and `margin-right` properties
banned-attributes.marginheight: Don't use the `marginheight` attribute. Instead, use the CSS `margin-top` and `margin-bottom` properties
banned-attributes.scrolling: Don't use the `scrolling` attribute. Instead, use the CSS `overflow` property
banned-attributes.width: Don't use the `width` attribute. Instead, use the CSS `width` property

html.lower-case-attribute-name: Use lower case for attribute names
html.text-elements-as-list-children: The text `{{-textContent}}` inside the `<{{-tag}}>` tag must be surrounded by `<{{-children}}>` tags
html.invalid-tag-location: The `<{{-tag}}>` tag can’t go inside the `<{{-parent}}>` tag.
html.invalid-tag-parent: The `<{{-tag}}>` tag needs to be inside the `{{-parent}}`
html.attribute-quotes:
You need to put the value of the `{{-attribute}}` attribute in quotation marks
Try: `{{-attribute}}="myvalue"`
html.attribute-value:
Every attribute needs a value.
Try: `myattribute="myvalue"`
html.doctype:
The first line of your HTML should always be:
`<!DOCTYPE html>`
html.duplicated-id: You can't use the id "{{-id}}" more than once in your HTML
html.img-src: `` tags need a `src` attribute, with the URL of the image you want to display.

deprecated-tag.b: You shouldn't use the `<b>` tag. Use the `<strong>` tag or the CSS `font-weight` property instead
deprecated-tag.big: You shouldn't use the `<big>` tag. Use the CSS `font-size` property instead
deprecated-tag.center: You shouldn't use the `<center>` tag. Use the CSS `text-align` property instead
deprecated-tag.font: You shouldn't use the `<font>` tag. Use the CSS `font-family` property instead
deprecated-tag.i: You shouldn't use the `<i>` tag. Use the <em> tag or the CSS `font-style: italic` property instead
deprecated-tag.strike: You shouldn't use the `<strike>` tag. Use the CSS property `text-decoration: line-through` instead
deprecated-tag.tt: You shouldn't use the `<tt>` tag. Use the `<code>` tag instead.

html.lower-case-tag-name: Use lower case for tag names
html.missing-title: Put a `<title>` tag inside your `<head>` tag
html.duplicated-title: You have more than one `<title>` tag in your document; you should only have one
html.attribute-in-closing-tag: You have an attribute in your closing `</{{-tag}}>` tag. Attributes always belong in the opening `<{{-tag}}>` tag.
html.close-tag-for-void-element: You don’t need a closing `</{{-tag}}>` tag. The `<{{-tag}}>` tag closes itself.
html.empty-title-element: You have an empty `<title>` tag. A `<title>` tag should always contain text.
html.html-in-css-block: It looks like you typed some HTML code inside a `<style>` tag. Remember that only CSS code can go inside a `<style>` tag.
html.invalid-attribute-name: `{{-attribute}}` isn’t allowed as an attribute name.
html.self-closing-non-void-element: {{tag, en-handle-an|capitalize}} `<{{-tag}}>` tag always needs a closing `</{{-tag}}>` tag. Writing `<{{-tag}}/>` is not allowed.
html.unclosed-tag: Your `<{{-tag}}>` tag needs to be closed by {{tag, en-handle-an}} `</{{-tag}}>` tag.
html.unexpected-close-tag: You have a closing `</{{-tag}}>` tag that doesn’t match any opening `<{{-tag}}>` tag.
html.unterminated-attribute-value: You forgot to put quotation marks after the value of the `{{-attribute}}` attribute in the `<{{-tag}}>` tag.
html.unterminated-open-tag: You forgot to put a `>` at the end of your `<{{-tag}}>` tag.
html.unterminated-close-tag: You forgot to put a `>` at the end of your `</{{-tag}}>` tag.
html.unterminated-comment: You have a comment that never ends. End the comment with `-->`
html.unbound-attribute-value: The value `{{-value}}` isn’t attached to an attribute. Are you missing an `=` sign?
html.invalid-tag-name: `<{{-tag}}>` isn’t a valid HTML tag. If you want to create a custom tag, make sure the name has a `-` in it, like `<my-tag>`
html.space-before-tag-name: You can’t put any space after the `<` in an HTML tag. Write `<{{-tag}}>` instead of `< {{-tag}}>`.
html.head-before-body: Your `<head>` element must come before your `<body>` element.
html.only-head-body-in-html: Only `<head>` and `<body>` tags may be direct children of `<html>`
html.invalid-tag-in-head: This tag is not allowed inside the `<head>`.
html.only-one-head-and-body: You may only have one `<head>` and one `<body>` tag in your document.
html.misplaced-close-tag: This closing `</{{-open}}>` tag should go to before the `</{{-close}}>` tag on line {{-mismatch}}.
html.duplicated-class: You shouldn’t have the class `{{-classes}}` more than once on the same element.
html.self-closing-tag: You don’t need to end self-closing tags with `/>`. Just use `<{{-tag}}>`.

css.missing-opening-curly: You should have a `{` at the end of this line.
css.missing-closing-curly: You have a starting `{` but no ending } to go with it.
css.property-missing-colon:
Put a colon (`:`) between the property and the value.
Try: `color: red;`
css.block-expected:
Start a block using `{` after your selector.
Try: `{{-error}} {`
css.extra-tokens-after-value: The `{{-token}}` at the end of this line doesn’t belong there.
css.illegal-token-after-combinator: After a `+` or `>` in a selector, you need to specify the name of another element, class, or ID
css.invalid-token: This line doesn't look like valid CSS.
css.invalid-token-in-selector: The `{{-token}}` on this line doesn’t belong here.
css.invalid-value: `{{-error}}` isn't a meaningful value for this property. Double-check what values you can use here.
css.invalid-negative-value: This property can’t have a negative value.
css.invalid-fractional-value: This property needs a whole number for a value.
css.missing-semicolon: Looks like you’re missing a semicolon (;) at the end of this line.
css.require-value: Put a value for `{{-error}}` after the colon.
css.selector-expected: Use a comma to separate multiple tag names, classes, or IDs.
css.unknown-property: `{{-error}}` isn't a property that CSS understands. Double-check the name of the property that you want to use.

javascript.unexpected-string: JavaScript doesn’t expect a string where you wrote `{{-value}}`. Remember that variable and function names aren’t surrounded in quotes.
javascript.unexpected-number: JavaScript doesn’t expect a number where you wrote `{{-value}}`. Remember that variable and function names have to start with a letter.
javascript.unexpected-identifier: JavaScript doesn’t expect a variable or property name where you wrote `{{-name}}`.
javascript.unexpected-token: JavaScript doesn’t expect a `{{-token}}` where you wrote one here.
javascript.invalid-left-hand-string: You wrote `{{-value}}` to the left of the = sign here, but that’s not a valid variable name. Remember that variable names aren’t surrounded by quotes.
javascript.invalid-left-hand-number: You wrote `{{-value}}` to the left of the = sign here, but that’s not a valid variable name. Remember that variable names have to start with a letter.
javascript.invalid-left-hand-boolean: You wrote `{{-value}}` to the left of the = sign here, but that’s not a valid variable name. Remember that true and false can’t be used as variable names.
javascript.invalid-left-hand-value: You wrote `{{-value}}` to the left of the = sign here, but that’s not a valid variable name.
javascript.unmatched: There is a `{{-openingSymbol}}` on this line that needs a closing `{{-closingSymbol}}`
javascript.closing-match: There is a `{{-openingSymbol}}` on this line that needs a closing `{{-closingSymbol}}`
javascript.expected-identifier: There's something missing from this line. Did you forget something?
javascript.undefined-variable: You can't use the variable `{{-variable}}` before declaring it.
javascript.unexpected-expression: It looks like there's something on this line that doesn't belong there
javascript.use-new-object: If you are making a new object, be sure to use it or store it in a variable
javascript.unnecessary-semicolon: You don't need a semicolon `;` on this line
javascript.missing-semicolon: You need a semicolon `;` at the end of this line
javascript.missing-parentheses:
There should be parentheses here.
Try: `new {{-object}}()`
javascript.strict-comparison-operator: Use `===` to check if two things are equal
javascript.unused-variable: You don't use the variable `{{-variable}}` anywhere
javascript.unclosed-string: The string on this line needs to end with another quotation mark
javascript.missing-token: Looks like you’re missing a `{{-token}}` here.

strict-operators.custom-case: There should be a `{{-goodOperator}}` where you wrote `{{-badOperator}}`

javascript.missing-library: `{{-variable}}` isn’t defined. Did you mean to enable the {{-library}} library?
javascript.unexpected: You typed a "{{character}}" here, but that’s not allowed in JavaScript.
javascript.end-of-input: Looks like you’re missing something at the end of this line.
javascript.tokenize-error: This line doesn’t look like valid JavaScript.
javascript.bad-invocation: You’re trying to call something that isn’t a function.

javascriptRuntime.not-a-function_with-name: You tried to call `{{-name}}()` as a function, but `{{-name}}` is not a function.
javascriptRuntime.not-a-function_with-name-type: You tried to call `{{-name}}()` as a function, but `{{-name}}` is a `{{-type}}`, not a function.
javascriptRuntime.not-a-function_with-name-value: You tried to call `{{-name}}()` as a function, but `{{-name}}` is `{{-value}}`, which is not a function.
javascriptRuntime.undefined-not-a-function_with-name: You tried to call `{{-name}}()` as a function, but `{{-name}}` does not have a value.
javascriptRuntime.null-not-a-function_with-name: You tried to call `{{-name}}()` as a function, but `{{-name}}` is null.
javascriptRuntime.access-property-of-undefined: You are trying to access a property of something that doesn't have a value.
javascriptRuntime.access-property-of-null: You are trying to access a property of a null value.
javascriptRuntime.access-property-of-undefined_with-name: You are trying to access a property of `{{-name}}`, but `{{-name}}` doesn't have a value.
javascriptRuntime.access-property-of-null_with-name: You are trying to access a property of a `{{-name}}`, but `{{-name}}` is null.
javascriptRuntime.read-property-of-undefined_with-property: You are trying to access the property `{{-property}}` on something that doesn't have a value.
javascriptRuntime.read-property-of-null_with-property: You are trying to access the property `{{-property}}` on a null value.
javascriptRuntime.set-property-of-undefined_with-property: You are trying to set the property `{{-property}}` on something that doesn't have a value.
javascriptRuntime.set-property-of-null_with-property: You are trying to set the property `{{-property}}` on a null value.
javascriptRuntime.infinite-loop: There is a loop in your code that looks like it might run forever. Check the loop to make sure it has the right stopping condition.
